title: Drawing, "The Palace of Donn' Anna at Naples", 1725–50
medium: Brush and brown and gray wash, pen and brown ink on paper
provenance: From the Collection of Giovanni Piancastelli; Mr and Mrs Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description:
Large palace with unfinished upper storey, seen from one corner, situated near a bay.  Boats and fishermen.  Beside it, at right, is a mediaeval palace.  At left are rocks.  Framing line. 

Note: The palace was begun in 1642 after designs by Cosimo Fanzago, but never completed, for Donn'Anna Carafa, wife of the viceroy, Filippo Ramiro Guzman  It is on the road to Pozzuoli....eed'70

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "The Palace of Donn' Anna at Naples", 1725–50.
1725–50. Brush and brown and gray wash, pen and brown ink on paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-2990.
